title: Solar panel sales boom as energy bills soar
description: More people are turning to renewable energy as a way to cut energy costs.

title: Prince Charles guest edits special edition of The Voice

title: Australia: Scott Morrison saga casts scrutiny on Queen's representative
description: The governor-general has been dragged into a backlash over ex-PM Scott Morrison's secret ministries.

title: Electricity and drought killing white storks
description: The extreme heat this summer has exacerbated the many hazards, leading to a sudden spike in deaths in Hungary.

title: Community transport: ‘It was a reason to get up in the morning’
description: Fuel prices are affecting volunteer community transport drivers helping elderly people in rural areas.

description: Match of the Day pundit Ian Wright says Erling Haaland is a "goalscoring monster" as he analyses the striker's hat-trick for Manchester City against Crystal Palace.

title: End of an era as seaside town's last indoor market shuts
description: Lesley and Martin Croxford say it is the "end of an era" but are looking forward to retirement.

title: Public health warning as bin strikes continue
description: Councils are being advised to "decontaminate" public areas where bins have overflowed.

title: EuroPride 2022: Serbia will not host event, says president
description: President Alexandar Vucic cancels the parade - but organisers insist they will go ahead.

title: Man dies after entering River Thames during arrest
description: The man, believed to be in his 20s, was not handcuffed at the time, the Metropolitan Police say.

title: United States to appoint first Arctic Ambassador

title: England v South Africa: James Anderson 'absolutely flattens' Dean Elgar's off stump for wicket
description: England's James Anderson sends Dean Elgar's off stump spiralling through the air as he bowls the South African captain out for 11 runs early on the third day of the second Test at Old Trafford.

title: New Zealand 18-25 Argentina: Pumas create history with victory in Christchurch
description: Argentina beat the All Blacks for the first time in New Zealand to move to the top of the Rugby Championship.

description: A number of countries criticise Russia as it blocks a joint UN declaration on nuclear security.

title: Hong Kong's Peak Tram reopens after 14 months
description: The service welcomes back passengers even as tight coronavirus restrictions remain.

title: Energy bills: Middle earners will need help with rising prices too, says chancellor
description: Even people on incomes of £45,000 are likely to need help with rising energy prices, Nadhim Zahawi says.

title: Oder mass fish deaths: Searching for clues to Polish-German border mystery
description: Scientists suspect a pollutant caused high salt levels, encouraging algae to flourish, suffocating fish.

description: Fixture lists for the Champions League, Europa League and Conference League are confirmed by Uefa.

title: LGBTQ+ Pride: Firms accused of 'rainbow-washing'

description: As thousands prepare to parade through Manchester on Saturday, Hannah Davis, Laurie Williams, Lloyd Wilson and Daniel Jervis tell BBC Sport about what the Pride movement means to LGBTQ+ people in sport.

description: Warnings about the impact of the energy price hike on families and calls for government action lead the papers.

title: Sanna Marin: How much partying is too much for a leader?
